topic.name: Physical & Political Geography
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Physical & Political Geography in History & Social Studies

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Identify places that are hot, cold, wet, or dry.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Name foods that grow in gardens.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the 'Breadbasket' regions of the world.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the seven continents on a globe.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Name the ocean closest to our home.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Identify my country and my state.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Name the capital city.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Identify that some countries are big and strong.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Name the ocean as a big wall that protects us.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Identify 'Buffer Zones' (space between enemies).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Identify mountains, hills, and valleys.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Name a big river.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Identify major landmarks (Grand Canyon, Nile River).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Maps and Globes (Latitude/Longitude, Cartography, Projections)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a map as a picture of a place.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Maps and Globes (Latitude/Longitude, Cartography, Projections)
objectives.objective_text: Name the North, South, East, and West directions.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that farmers need rain.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that penguins live in the ice and camels in the sand.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that most of the earth is covered in water.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that land masses have different shapes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that a border is a line where a country ends.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Observe flags of different countries.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that leaders want to keep their people safe.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that islands are hard to attack.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that people build cities near water.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that it is hard to build a house on a steep mountain.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Maps and Globes (Latitude/Longitude, Cartography, Projections)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that a globe is round like the earth.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Maps and Globes (Latitude/Longitude, Cartography, Projections)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that blue means water on a map.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the main climate zones (Tropical, Temperate, Polar).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why we can't grow bananas in Alaska.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Biomes and Climate Zones (Relation to Agriculture)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the concept of 'carrying capacity' of land.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the defining features of each continent.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between a continent and a country.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Locate the five oceans and major seas.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the strategic importance of the Atlantic vs. Pacific oceans.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Continents and Oceans (Global Map Literacy)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the naming conventions of disputed bodies of water (e.g., Persian Gulf).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how many countries are in North America.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why we have borders (safety, laws).

objectives.objective_text: Locate major world powers on a map.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the concept of 'Sovereignty'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Countries, Capitals, Borders, and Boundaries (Political Division)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the Westphalian system of nation-states.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize why being near the ocean is good for trade.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that mountains can stop armies.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why Russia wants warm-water ports.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Geopolitics (How Geography Influences Power)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the thesis that 'Geography is Destiny' (to an extent).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize why early civilizations started by rivers.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Explain how mountains can protect a country from enemies.

objectives.objective_text: Explain why some landforms act as barriers to migration.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Major Landforms, Rivers and Lakes (Impact on Human Settlement)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the theory of 'Hydraulic Civilizations'.

objectives.objective_text: Summarize how to use a grid to find a city.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between a map (flat) and globe (round).

objectives.objective_text: Use a map key/legend.

objectives.objective_text: Explain why all flat maps are distorted.

objectives.objective_text: Defend the utility of the Gall-Peters projection vs. Robinson.

objectives.objective_text: Compare the animals in a rainforest with a savanna.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the relationship between latitude and growing seasons.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret a climate graph.

objectives.objective_text: Connect biodiversity to specific biomes.

objectives.objective_text: Defend the stewardship of arable land.

objectives.objective_text: Compare the size of Asia with Europe.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the impact of continental drift on current map positions.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret a map showing the Prime Meridian and Equator dividing hemispheres.

objectives.objective_text: Connect ocean currents to global weather patterns.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze how borders change after wars.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the difference between a nation (people) and a state (government).

objectives.objective_text: Connect colonialism to the borders in Africa.

objectives.objective_text: Compare a strong location with a weak location.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the Heartland Theory (control the land, control the world).

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the strategic value of oil reserves.

objectives.objective_text: Connect geography to the outcome of WWII.

objectives.objective_text: Compare living in a valley vs. living on a plateau.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze how topography influences trade routes.

objectives.objective_text: Connect river deltas to agricultural fertility.

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the geopolitical significance of the 'World Island' (Eurasia/Africa).
